item.title: NPCDrops help :S
item.dc:creator: @Yourserver Yourserver
item.description:
@Yourserver wrote:

[quote=“l0gin., post:10, topic:448835”]Open up item2.java and find something related to this:

[code]public static int runerock[] = {451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,1481,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451};

public static int randomRuneRock()
{
	return runerock[(int)(Math.random()*runerock.length)];
}[/code]

now under that declare

[code]public static int man123[] = {4151,4153};

public static int randomman123()
{
	return man123[(int)(Math.random()*man123.length)];
}[/code]

now open up npchandler and search for

and under one of those add

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomman123(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

the number after .npcType == is the ID of the NPC that you want to drop those items

now remove the “1 995” from your file in your original post, compile and run your server

now spawn a man and kill it, you should either get a whip or a granite maul.

to make the whip uncommon/morerare you would do something like this instead

This would make the chances of a man dropping a whip 1:3, so every 3 kills on average you should be getting a whip as a drop

I sort of rushed that but if you get any errors tell me and yeah to anyone reading I know it can be done better[/quote]

there isnt a item2.java
and there aint any of that in item and in npc hander that code aint in there either:/ this source is weird ahah

Read full topic

item.title: NPCDrops help :S
item.dc:creator: @l0gin1 l0gin.
item.description:
@l0gin1 wrote:

Open up item2.java and find something related to this:

[code]public static int runerock[] = {451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,1481,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451,451};

public static int randomRuneRock()
{
	return runerock[(int)(Math.random()*runerock.length)];
}[/code]

now under that declare

[code]public static int man123[] = {4151,4153};

public static int randomman123()
{
	return man123[(int)(Math.random()*man123.length)];
}[/code]

now open up npchandler and search for

and under one of those add

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 1) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomman123(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

the number after .npcType == is the ID of the NPC that you want to drop those items

now remove the “1 995” from your file in your original post, compile and run your server

now spawn a man and kill it, you should either get a whip or a granite maul.

to make the whip uncommon/morerare you would do something like this instead

This would make the chances of a man dropping a whip 1:3, so every 3 kills on average you should be getting a whip as a drop

I sort of rushed that but if you get any errors tell me and yeah to anyone reading I know it can be done better

Read full topic
